arm_group.arm_group_label: MPFL reconstruction and Lateral retinaculum release

brief_summary.textblock:
The investigators hypothesis is lateral retinaculum release has no effect on treatment of
      Patellar Recurrent Dislocation with Medial Patellofemoral Ligament (MPFL) reconstruction.

clinical_study.brief_title: Medial Patellofemoral Ligament Reconstruction With or Without Lateral Retinaculum Release

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:

          -  age between 18yo and 45yo

          -  indication for MPFL reconstruction

          -  unilateral or bilateral indication

        Exclusion Criteria:

          -  indication for bony procedures

          -  previous surgery for PF disorders

          -  patient refusal

intervention.arm_group_label: MPFL reconstruction and Lateral retinaculum release
intervention.description: MPFL is performed with a standard technique using gracilis tendon. A tunnel is performed at the femoral part with a bioabsorbable screw fixation and 2 bundles with suture fixation at the patellar side
intervention.intervention_name: MPFL reconstruction and lateral retinaculum release

facility.name: Centre Albert Trillat, Croix-Rousse Hospital, Hospices Civils de Lyon

clinical_study.official_title: Randomized Control Trial on Lateral Retinaculum Release in MPFL Reconstruction

oversight_info.authority: France: Afssaps - Agence française de sécurité sanitaire des produits de santé (Saint-Denis)

primary_outcome.description: IKDC score, patellar tilt measurement on x-rays and CT-scan

required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on June 04, 2014
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.study_design: Allocation: Randomized, Endpoint Classification: Efficacy Study, Intervention Model: Parallel Assignment, Masking: Open Label, Primary Purpose: Treatment
